topic.title: HPE Helion 2.0 Development Platform: Install the Service Installer

section.p: The installation procedure has changed significantly since the last release. The HDP Installer 2.0, also known as HDPI, is a plugin for the python-openstackclient (OSC). It is able to leverage the authentication, configuration and command line option parsing that is already part of OSC to greatly simplify the installation process.
section.note: You must have satisfied all prerequisites before beginning installation.
Do not source service.osrc, keystone.osrc, or any other file before you begin.

section.title: Install the HPE Helion Development Platform Installation Client

ol.li: Using your preferred web browser, navigate to HPE Helion Download Network (HDN) and create an account if you haven't done so already.
Click the HPE Helion Development Platform download package.
From the list of options, click HPE Helion Development Platform 2.0.
Click the blue Download button in the upper right hand corner.

The best option is to download directly to the HPE Helion OpenStack Deployer. If you can not download directly to the HPE Helion OpenStack deployer, copy all the downloaded packages to a USB stick or external hard drive and then copy the files onto the physical machine hosting the HPE Helion OpenStack Deployer. Make sure there is enough space; the file sizes can be significant.
SSH to the HPE Helion OpenStack Deployer.

Create and source the Virtual Environment. In this example, <dev_platform_installer-devplat_installer-#.#.#>.gz is the name of the installer. This process creates a directory under /opt which is owned by root. This directory requires sudo permissions to create, so the owner of that folder needs to be changed to whatever the user will log in as; in this example, the value is stack. The directory name must exactly match the name of the installer (<dev_platform_installer-devplat_installer-#.#.#.gz>) or HDPI commands will fail. Do not rename the directory and ensure you include the file extension.sudo mkdir -p /opt/stack/venv/<dev_platform_installer-devplat_installer-#.#.#> sudo tar -C /opt/stack/venv/<dev_platform_installer-devplat_installer-#.#.#> -xzf <dev_platform_installer-devplat_installer-#.#.#>.tgz sudo chown stack.stack /opt/stack/venv/<dev_platform_installer-devplat_installer-#.#.#> source /opt/stack/venv/<dev_platform_installer-devplat_installer-#.#.#>/bin/activate

Test the installation by retrieving a list of installable files. openstack hdpi --os-cloud mycloud listIf further troubleshooting information is required, add the --debug option to the end of the previous command.
